entry.value: # This example relies on ggplot2 and grid, if these packages are not part of %%00010# your R installation, please add them!%%00010require(ggplot2)%%00010require(grid)%%00010%%00010title %%00009= knime.flow.in[["title"]]%%00010%%00010bars %%00009= knime.in[knime.flow.in[["bars"]]]%%00010groups %%00009= knime.in[knime.flow.in[["groups"]]]%%00010%%00010bar_column = as.factor(as.matrix(bars))%%00010group_column = as.factor(as.matrix(groups))%%00010%%00010# define a plot theme%%00010# http://docs.ggplot2.org/0.9.2.1/theme.html for more options%%00010clean_theme = theme(panel.background = element_blank(),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009plot.title = element_text(size=20, face="bold", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009panel.border = element_rect(color = "white", linetype = "solid", fill = "transparent"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009axis.title.x = element_text(size=18, face="italic", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009axis.title = element_text(size=18, face="italic", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009axis.text = element_text(size=18, face="italic", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009axis.text.x = element_text(size=14, face="italic", colour = "black", angle = 45),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009legend.text = element_text(size=18, face="italic", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009legend.title = element_text(size=18, face="italic", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009panel.grid = element_blank()%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009)%%00010%%00010%%00010labels = labs(list(%%00009title = knime.flow.in[["title"]], %%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009x = knime.flow.in[["bars"]],%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009fill = knime.flow.in[["groups"]]%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009)%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009)%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00010plot <- qplot(bar_column, data = knime.in, geom = "bar", fill = group_column)%%00010%%00010plot + clean_theme + labels

entry.key: Output non numbers (NaN, Inf, -Inf) as missing cells
